results.title: Simvastatin interferes with cancer 'stem-cell' plasticity reducing metastasis in ovarian cancer.
results.text_hl: Here, we studied whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, a lipophilic statin, could impair the @<m>DISEASE_Calcinosis_Cutis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092182 @@@metastatic@@@ potential of CICs in high-grade @DISEASE_Ovarian_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D010051 @@@serous ovarian cancer@@@ (@DISEASE_Ovarian_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D010051 @@@HGS-ovC@@@), the most lethal among the @DISEASE_Genital_Neoplasms_Female @DISEASE_MESH:D005833 @@@gynecologic malignancies@@@. qPCR, immunoblotting and immunohistochemistry were used to assess @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ effects on proteins involved in stemness and epithelial-mesenchymal cell plasticity (EMT).

citations.NLM: Kato S, Liberona MF, Cerda-Infante J, Sánchez M, Henríquez J, Bizama C, Bravo ML, Gonzalez P, Gejman R, Brañes J, García K, Ibañez C, Owen GI, Roa JC, Montecinos V, Cuello MA. Simvastatin interferes with cancer 'stem-cell' plasticity reducing metastasis in ovarian cancer. Endocr Relat Cancer. 2018 Oct;25(10):821-836. PMID: 29848667
